channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2023120320
item.description:
Report X-2023120320

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-02
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Once the package was brought to our attention, it was placed inside of a plastic hazardous bag and then transferred into a tote to mitigate any additional spillage. The tote was then transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: The box itself had several stains from the corrosive liquid that leaked from the bottles. The bottles themselves had their caps loosened and didn't contain any additional sealants to prevent the spillage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a plastic hazardous bag and then transferred into a tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

item.title: Report E-2023120225
item.description:
Report E-2023120225

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-20T18:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 8, 2023, one (1) one-gallon glass jar containing sulfuric acid (UN1830) was damaged by a forklift and released its full contents to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Marion Environmental Services (MES) to remediate the impacted site. MES personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the sulfuric acid-impacted impacted dock and pallet. The crew down stacked the pallet, re packaged, and secured cleaned freight to be shipped. MES personnel solidified and neutralized the damaged glass jar of sulfuric acid. The damaged glass jar, impacted absorbents and cardboard box were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023120588
item.description:
Report X-2023120588

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained eleven glass jars packed with Styrofoam peanuts. One of the jars broke spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023120365
item.description:
Report X-2023120365

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-03
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box found on HMPA staging pallet in tote smelling faintly of alcohol. Prior context unknown. Mishandling: overhead scan 12/3 20:26 at NASH. Package brought under ventilation. DescribePack: One of three 4 Liter jerricans lost 2oz of fluid due to a loose cap closure, despite tape-like band around cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2023120364
item.description:
Report X-2023120364

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-02
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazard class 8 hazmat spill found by APA on QA Intercept / Overhead Discharge Chute. Mishandling: Ftrack shows overhead scan 12/2 21:52 at NASH. The package was placed in a lined tote for transport to the HMPA. DescribePack: Two of two 1 gallon jerricans lost 6oz of fluid due to internal corrosion of the safety seals under the cap closures. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation utilized.

item.title: Report X-2023120661
item.description:
Report X-2023120661

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to our attention from just the smell alone. Once it was confirmed to be a damaged hazmat, it was promptly placed into a hazardous plastic bag and then into a red hazardous tote. The tote was then transferred to the HazMat station for further investigation. DescribePack: The package itself was sealed but had wet stains all over, mostly towards the bottom of the box. The plastic cap was completely off, and the metal sealant was also pull up a bit which resulted in a leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed inside of a hazardous plastic bag and red tote to mitigate any additional spillage and keep the strong fumes at contained.

item.title: Report E-2023120204
item.description:
Report E-2023120204

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 1, 2023, two (2) 55-gallon drums of UN3265 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release and worked them in with hand tools. All UN3265-impacted material was containerized in three (3) 55-galon drums. The two (2) damaged 55-gallon drums were overpacked into two (2) 95-gallon overpacks for terminal disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2023120402

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG DAMAGED DURING SORTATION. PKG PLACED INSIDE A LINED HAZMAT TOTE INSIDE HAZMAT CAGE FOR EVALUATION. DescribePack: PKG WAS OPENED AND THREE OF THE CONENTS WAS MISSING. ONE CONTENT CAP WAS MISSING. IT APPEARS LIQUID MAY HAVE LEAKED BUT THE BOX WASN'T WET. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: TURNED UPRIGHT SO LIQUID WOULDN'T LEAK

item.title: Report X-2023120380
item.description:
Report X-2023120380

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-03
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Once the package was brought to our attention, it was promptly placed into a tote to mitigate any additional spillage. Upon seeing the type of contents inside, the package was then brought to the HazMat cage for further investigation. DescribePack: The package had a bleached, wet patch at the bottom of the box. Two of the bottles had loose caps however only one of them was entirely off which caused a spillage. The bottles were individually placed inside of plastic ziploc bags so that helped with keeping the bleach contained. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a tote to mitigate any chance of additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023120376
item.description:
Report X-2023120376

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-03
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to our attention as it had a wet surface at the bottom and slight leakage. The package was placed into a plastic hazardous bag and into a red tote to mitigate any additional potential spillage. The tote was then transferred to the HazMat station for further investigation. It was also found that a previous station did not report the the first damages properly and instead made a RTS report. DescribePack: The box was entirely soaked at the bottom and had some minor leaks spilling out. Two of the 1-gallon bottles had loose caps which resulted in a spillage although they were all inside of a plastic bag which mitigated a lot of the spillage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a hazardous plastic bag and then into a red tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: When the package was brought to our attention, it was quickly placed into a plastic hazardous bag and into a red tote to mitigate any potential additional spillage. The tote was then transferred to the HazMat cage for further inspection. DescribePack: The bottom of the box was soaked in the detergent. One of the 2.5-gallon bottles had a broken cap. The cap is crack on one side which resulted in a leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a plastic hazardous bag and into a red tote to mitigate any potential additional spillage.
